item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. AI Flame Graphs (73 points | 40 comments)
2. Google's TOS doesn't eliminate a user's Fourth Amendment rights, judge rules [pdf] (181 points | 124 comments)
3. Steam games will need to disclose kernel-level anti-cheat on store pages (137 points | 51 comments)
4. Chain-of-Thought Can Hurt Performance on Tasks Where Thinking Makes Humans Worse (23 points | 3 comments)
5. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (884 points | 365 comments)
6. SimpleQA (46 points | 10 comments)
7. An Italian 'fruit detective' who investigates centuries-old paintings (9 points | discuss)
8. Pushing the frontiers of audio generation (130 points | 55 comments)
9. M4 MacBook Pro (566 points | 680 comments)
10. Show HN: LlamaPReview – AI GitHub PR reviewer that learns your codebase (60 points | 26 comments)
11. DeepSeek v2.5 – open-source LLM comparable to GPT-4o, but 95% less expensive (54 points | 6 comments)
12. Rubocop-obsession: RuboCop extension focused on higher-level concepts (17 points | 2 comments)
13. Crafting Painterly Shaders (34 points | discuss)
14. Infisical (YC W23) is hiring full stack engineers (remote or in SF) ( | hide)

20. Representing web applications as knowledge graphs (46 points | 3 comments)
21. CFPB finalizes personal financial data rights rule (101 points | 33 comments)
22. Google CEO says more than a quarter of the company's new code is created by AI (135 points | 154 comments)
23. Morsing of the Dead [video] (4 points | 1 comment)
24. Sketchy financials send Supermicro auditors running for the hills (46 points | 3 comments)

27. The Rip in the World (8 points | discuss)
28. The Karma connection in Chrome Web Store (128 points | 29 comments)
29. Fruits (2020) (114 points | 21 comments)
